title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
17:46 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
17:56 <evalica> has quit  
17:56 <sburjan> has quit  
18:04 <Enygma`> has quit  
18:06 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
18:07 <+jvelociter> hello guys  
18:07 <+jvelociter> mflorea: just a FYI: I'm not able to edit a page with the WYSIWYG editor on incubator  
18:07 <+jvelociter> it loads for ever  
18:07 <+jvelociter> tried in FF 3.6 and Opera  
18:08 <+mflorea> let me check  
18:11 <+mflorea> jvelociter: the wiki was not upgraded. But be carefull with http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise31M2#HWYSIWYGEditorConfiguration  
18:11 <+mflorea> I mean, the wiki pages  
18:11 <+jvelociter> mflorea: OK, thanks  
18:11 <+mflorea> the WYSIWYG editor configuration at least  
18:12 <+mflorea> I think the best is to delete XWiki.WysiwygEditor\* pages before importing the new ones  
18:13 <+mflorea> due to an issue with xclass upgrade that was fixed by Sergiu in 3.1 final  
18:13 <+jvelociter> ok  
18:14 <arkub> has quit  
18:21 <+jvelociter> mflorea: are you aware of an issue in ancient versions of XWiki where one could not use the paste plugin in the WYSIWYG two times in a row ?  
18:21 <+mflorea> sounds familiar  
18:21 <+jvelociter> first time would work OK, then the second time the textarea in the dialog would be disabled  
18:21 <+jvelociter> happens on a 2.7.1 wiki  
18:21 <+mflorea> hmm, let me search jira  
18:30 <+jvelociter> didn't find anything  
18:30 <+jvelociter> note I don't reproduce on trunk  
18:31 <+mflorea> I may fix it with http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-4503  
18:50 <+mflorea> jvelociter: I can't reproduce it with a fresh 2.7.2 and FF 5.0  
18:51 <+jvelociter> mflorea: OK I will do more test. Just for my information fixing it would imply rebuilding the WYSIWYG or this is just server side stuff ?  
18:52 <+mflorea> it's \*only\* client side, so the WYSIWYG editor needs to be rebuilt  
18:54 <+mflorea> moreover, the changes I made to XWIKI-4503 are important so porting the fix to 2.7.1 is not trivial  
18:54 <+mflorea> let me check with an older FF version on 2.7.2  
18:55 <tekzilla> has quit  
18:56 <+jvelociter> ok thanks forthe details  
18:57 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
19:13 <Spazholio> Ok, boneheaded question coming up: if I have "$msg.get('platform.core.profile.section.links')" on my profile template, it displays as "External Links" when the page is rendered.  Where is that set?  I'd like the ability to change it.  
19:15 <+mflorea> jvelociter: I can reproduce it with FF3 on 2.7.2 but it works fine with FF5. The best option IMO is to upgrade FF  
19:15 <+jvelociter> mflorea: OK  
19:17 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:21 <abusenius> has quit  
19:21 <+mflorea> Spazholio: there are two options (1) Extract ApplicationResources.properties file matching your language from the xwiki-core jar(or xwiki-oldcore on newer XE versions) that is found in WEB-INF/lib and copy it to WEB-INF/classes. Then you edit it, look for the platform.core.profile.section.links key and change its value. Finally restart the server.  
19:21 <+mflorea> or, option (2), you can define a translation bundle in a wiki page as indicated in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/InternationalizingApplications and there you overwrite the platform.core.profile.section.links with the desired value.  
19:22 <Spazholio> Same would go for adding in additional sections in the Profile screen?  
19:29 <+mflorea> if you care about i18n then yes. You can alway put the text directly in the template of course, e.g. replace "$msg.get('platform.core.profile.section.links')" with "External Links" , but it will be the same in all languages.  
19:31 <Spazholio> Perfect, thanks.  At least I wasn't overlooking something that was staring me in the face.  
19:31 <+mflorea> you're welcome  
19:34 <StefanM> has left #xwiki  
19:36 <mflorea> has quit  
19:36 <jvelociter> has quit  
19:49 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:54 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
20:43 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki

21:14 <Denis> has quit  
21:17 <Denis1> has quit  
21:28 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
21:30 <jvdrean> has quit  
22:01 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
22:09 <Denis> has quit  
22:28 <Spazholio> I'm currently using the following in a panel: "#set($bookmarks = "$xwiki.getUserPreference('bookmarks')")"  It seems to return the "bookmark" preference (which is a textbox, identical to the Address preference) for the user just fine, but the formatting is a little weird whenever I have a wikilink in there.  Any ideas why that is, or is there something I can do about it?  
22:28 <Spazholio> http://pastebin.com/e6wdAE9W  <-- example of what I see in the panel's source  
23:58 <Xnewbie> has quit
